Articles.Content:
Are there any great mods for satellites? I need a satellite so I can study the far reaches of space (not real study, just to spice up my solar system). Please tell me the most popular or best satellite mod you had, then please send me a link, I can really put a change to my solar system if I had the satellites, atleast solar panels! ???

 [shadow=red,left]Thank you for the links of the satellites![/shadow]
NOTE: I have tried looking for some Satellite mods but I need a more realistic kind.
Try Probodobodyne. Its great. Linky here: [http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=6397.0](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=6397.0)

This is a pretty neat one. [http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=11622.0](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=11622.0)

The solar panels will always point to the sun, and the body will always point to the planet.

> 
> Try Probodobodyne. Its great. Linky here: [http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=6397.0](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=6397.0)

Thanks! I think that will be good enough for trying to make a starter rocket for bringing out satellites, though, my Munlander may be able to get into orbit (longer, hopefully) and detach the satellite and let the satellite orbit!

Great! It always points to the sun, eh? That is just how a real satellite is, usually =P
